title: Ireland's 'access to cash infrastructure' legislation to come into effect on Friday
description:
Ireland's 'Access to Cash' legislation will come into effect on Friday, Ireland's Department of Finance confirmed on Monday, November 24.

Ireland's Tánaiste and Minister for Finance Simon Harris TD is set to sign order numbers five and ten of the Finance (Provision of Access to Cash Infrastructure)...

title: State needs to spend €50bn on climate action up to 2050, warns Central Bank
description:
Sandbags and flood defence in a shop doorway in Galway city centre during a weather warning in October. Photograph: Brian Lawless/PA Wire

Additional investment of more than €50 billion is likely to be needed until 2050 to meet Ireland’s decarbonisation targets with most of it incurred over the next...

title: Central Bank chief warns on soaring global share prices
description:
The head of the Central Bank has warned about soaring share prices on international stock markets and the potential for a "correction".

Gabriel Makhlouf said "high equity valuations are driven by US technology and artificial intelligence related stocks."

Mr Makhlouf added there was a "disconnect b...

title: InterTradeIreland Q3 survey shows slowing growth momentum
description:
The latest quarterly business survey from InterTradeIreland points to more subdued economic sentiment in the third quarter of 2025.

The survey, which is the biggest across the island, reveals that the proportion of firms reporting growth is 28%, the lowest level since 2018 while the number describi...

title: Microsoft to ‘unlock Ireland’s AI potential’ with €4m investment
description:
The tech company has committed €4m to AI skilling initiatives in Ireland, supporting communities, businesses and individuals in their AI prep.

Technology giant Microsoft has released a socio-economic impact report, showing that over the past decade the organisation has contributed €40bn to Ireland’...

title: Did the local Longford greyhound track closure impact the county town economy?
description:
A war of words has erupted between a Longford Oireachtas member and a a life-long animal rights campaigner over opinion on the closure of Longford greyhound track and the economic impact on the county town.



Fine Gael Senator Paraic Brady said during a Seanad debate on Thursday on the funding of h...

description:

title: Northern Ireland potted huge economic benefit with The 153rd Open at Royal Portrush
description:
The 153rd Open at Royal Portrush in Co Antrim generated more than £280 million in economic benefit for Northern Ireland, according to independent research commissioned by The R&A and Tourism Northern Ireland.

Staging The 153rd Open provided a total economic impact of £89.2 million to Northern Irela...

title: NI beef and lamb important for local economy - AERA Committee chair
description:
Chair of Northern Ireland's Agriculture, Environment and Rural Affairs (AERA) Committee, Robbie Butler MLA, has highlighted the importance of the red meat sectors to the local economy.

He made the assertion while visiting the 2025 Royal Ulster Agricultural Society (RUAS) Beef and Lamb Championship....

title: Tánaiste says fiscal framework one of his main priorities
description:
The Tánaiste and Minister for Finance has said one of his main priorities in his new role will be to set out a medium-term fiscal framework for the country.

Simon Harris said it will be "a new medium-term economic plan for Ireland, which ends short-termism" and will "anchor our spending and taxatio...

title: Is Ireland’s supercharged growth a mirage?
description:
Economic forecasts here, no matter how positive, always come with caveats. Photograph: iStock

Ireland’s economy is like a dog simultaneously barking and wagging its tail. The question is which end to believe.

While the European Commission is forecasting the economy here will record “exceptional” g...

title: ‘Difficult news’ for homeowners as house price growth slows
description:
Average UK house prices increased by 2.6% in the 12 months to September, slowing from 3.1% growth in the year to August, the Office for National Statistics (ONS) said.

Average house prices increased to £293,000 (2.0% annual growth) in England, £209,000 (2.7%) in Wales and £194,000 (5.3%) in Scotlan...

title: Unemployment rate hits highest level since 2021 - CSO
description:
The unemployment rate for 15 to 65-year-olds reached 5.3% in the third quarter of this year, up 0.8 percentage points from 4.5% the same time in 2024.

This is the highest rate recorded since the third quarter of 2021 as Ireland emerged from Covid.

There were 155,400 unemployed people aged 15-74 ye...

title: Unemployment rate hits four-year high in latest CSO Labour Force Survey
description:
The rate of unemployment across the economy has risen to 5.3 per cent, its highest level in four years, according to the latest Central Statistics Office (CSO) Labour Force Survey (LFS) which was published on Thursday morning.

The rate of unemployment across the economy has risen to 5.3 per cent, i...

title: Ireland's 'hardest working counties' revealed in new study
description:
A new study has revealed the hardest-working counties in Ireland, with Laois taking first place.

The research, from leading business utility consultants Procure.ie, used the latest figures from Ireland's Central Statistics Office (CSO) to compare how far people travel to work, how long those journe...
